definition: to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: An overflowing laundry basket stares menacingly from the corner of the room.
sentences.chinese: 房间角落里，装得满满的洗衣篮不怀好意地盯着我。

sentences.english: The tiger stared at him from its corners, malevolent and unblinking .
sentences.chinese: 老虎在角落里眼睛一眨不眨地看着他，不怀好意。

sentences.english: Some parts of our programs are modified by some ill-disposed persons.
sentences.chinese: 我们的部分程序被不怀好意之人给修改了。

sentences.english: The tattooed man leans toward me ominously.
sentences.chinese: 纹身男不怀好意的朝我靠了过来。

sentences.english: Spreading a rumor with malicious intent。
He shot Harry a nasty grin through the gap in his mother's arms.
sentences.chinese: 他躲在母亲臂弯里不怀好意地朝哈利撇嘴一笑。

sentences.english: Will of the Woods leered at her even as he took a knee.
sentences.chinese: 伍兹的威尔即使跪下也对她投以不怀好意的一瞥。

definition: lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
see 色瞇瞇|色眯眯[se4 mi1 mi1]
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
